title: LegacyXChange and MAB Sign Letter Of Intent
text:
LegacyXChange, Inc.
A-List Athletes to Participate in New Online Platform
BOCA RATON, Florida , October 22, 2015 /PRNewswire/ --
LegacyXChange, Inc. (OTC: LEGX ) ("LegacyXChange" or the "Company") is excited to announce that MAB Celebrity Services has signed a Letter of Intent to offer newly created Original Collectibles on our soon-to-be launched site LegacyXChange.com. MAB will provide items created by its extensive roster of high-profile athletes, using world-class anti-counterfeit technology created for LegacyXChange, to ensure authenticity and track ownership.
"Having MAB participate as our first partner to provide A-List athletes is a testament to the value proposition of LegacyXChange," states Bill Bollander CEO. "They (MAB) are clearly an industry leader, having agreements with an impressive list of over 50 athletes, as well as proven success in handling and marketing collectibles. The fact that they see the enormous potential in the technology we are introducing to the market is a huge step forward for us. We plan to feature many of their exclusive collectible items, in our national advertising, including those from Pete Rose , Cal Ripken Jr. and Rick Flair , to name a few. Being able to scientifically guarantee lifetime authenticity to buyers will make LegacyXChange the premier place to acquire such collectibles."
"We are very excited to work closely with LegacyXChange to offer exclusive collectibles from our athletes, using LegacyXChange technology can make an enormous impact on the industry", states Mollie Ann Bracigliano , owner MAB. "The collectible industry is growing and the time is right to assure buyers their purchases are authentic and can be verified forever. My team and I look forward to a great partnership. We plan to offer a new assortment of popular collectibles for our players, who are really excited to have their items nationally advertised by LegacyXChange.
LegacyXChange plans to release more information regarding MAB athletes' offerings prior to launch.
About LegacyXChange, Inc. and LegacyXChange.com.
The company is currently developing an online site for the trading of collectibles and memorabilia across numerous product categories. Utilizing unique DNA and Rare Earth Mineral-based authentication solutions to enable collectibles and memorabilia to be permanently marked through ink in a pen, our goal is to provide the ongoing ability to guarantee authenticity of items. All items marked with this technology will be sold as Original, directly from athletes and celebrities. The site will also allow third party collectible items to be listed and sold.
To learn more about LegacyXChange, please visit: http://www.legacyxchange.com/
About MAB Celebrity Services:
MAB Celebrity Services is a full-service sports marketing company, specializing in athlete relations, and we are the premiere company for putting together themed-oriented events.
MAB celebrated its tenth anniversary recently and feel very blessed to be doing something that we have loved our whole life, collecting sports memorabilia and working with our heroes from our childhood.
MAB Celebrity Services has worked with over 7500 athletes over the course of their time in this business and have specialized in putting together such events as The Team of Dreams at the Field of Dreams, which was a charity event at the Field of Dreams Movie Site in Dubuque, Iowa , a softball game and an autograph show and the proceeds went to the Wounded Warriors. It was star-studded, with over 12 Hall of Fame baseball players.
MAB currently has over 60 athletes exclusively, some notable being, the greatest catcher that ever played the game, Johnny Bench , Mr. October, Reggie Jackson , The Hit King, Pete Rose, the Ironman, Cal Ripken, Jr. , Pedro Martinez , Randy Johnson , USA World Cup Champions Hope Solo and Christen Press , legendary Boston Red Sox baseball Hall of Famers Carlton Fisk , Jim Rice and Dennis Eckersley, legendary Baltimore Oriole, the Human Vacuum Cleaner, Brooks Robinson , current NY Met pitcher Steven Matz , and the entire 1980 Olympic Hockey Team.
MAB had a vision that we wanted to create events that our customers, could reminisce about where they were when the 1980 hockey team won the Gold Medal or the 1986 Mets Won the World Series, and allow them the opportunity to meet and socialize with the greatest athletes of our time.
